a: ah! ha! oh! ooh! aw! (emotion word)
akesi: non-cute animal, reptile, amphibian, dinosaur, monster
anpa: bottom, down, under, below, floor, beneath
esun: market, shop, fair, bazaar, business, transaction
ike: bad, evil, wrong, evil, overly complex, (figuratively) unhealthy
insa: centre, content, inside, between; internal organ, stomach
jaki: disgusting, obscene, sickly, toxic, unclean, unsanitary
ken: possibility, ability, power to do things, permission
kepeken: to use, with, by means of
ko: clay, clinging form, dough, semi-solid, paste, powder
kulupu: community, company, group, nation, society, tribe
la: (between the context phrase and the main sentence)
lawa: head, mind VERB to control, direct, guide, lead, own, plan, regulate, rule
li: (between any subject except mi and sina and its verb; also used to introduce a new verb for the same subject)
lili: little, small, short, a bit, young
linja: long and flexible thing; cord, hair, rope, thread, yarn
lipu: flat object, book, document, card, paper
lukin: eye, to look at, see, examine, observe, read, watch
ma: earth, land, outdoors, world, country, territory, soil
mani: money, material wealth, currency, dollar, capital
moku: to eat, drink, consume, swallow, ingest, food, meal
musi: fun, playing, game, recreation, art, entertainment
mute: many, several, very, much, a lot, abundant, numerous, more
nasa: silly, crazy, foolish, drunk, strange, stupid, weird
nasin: way, manner, custom, road, path, doctrine, system, method
open: to begin, start, open, turn on
pakala: blunder, accident, mistake, destruction, damage, breaking
pali: to do, take action on, work on, build, make, prepare
palisa: long hard thing, branch, rod, stick
pan: to give, send, emit, provide, put, release
pana: dar, p√¥r, enviar, colocar, soltar, emitir
pini: end, tip, completed, finished, past, done, ago
poka: side, hip, next to, neighboring, in the accompaniment of
pona: good, simplicity, positivity, good, simple, positive, nice, correct, right, fix, repair
pu: interacting with the official Toki Pona book
sama: same, similar, equal, of equal status or position
seli: fire, warmth, heat, hot, warm, cooked
selo: outside, surface, skin, shell, bark, shape, peel
sewi: high, up, above, top, over, on, superior, elevated, religious, formal
sike: circle, wheel, sphere, ball, cycle, round, cyclical
sona: knowledge, wisdom, intelligence, understanding, know, understand, know how to
suli: big, tall, long, adult, important, enlarge, size
supa: horizontal surface, e.g. furniture, table, chair, pillow, floor
tan: from, by, because of, since, origin, cause
tawa: to, in order to, towards, for, until, go, leave, walk, travel, move

toki: language, talking, speech, communication, say, talk, chat
tomo: indoor constructed space, e.g. house, home, room, building
utala: conflict, disharmony, competition, fight, war, battle, attack, blow, argument, physical or verbal violence, hit, strike, attack, compete against
wan: one, a, unit, element, particle, part, piece
wawa: energy, strength, power, energetic, strong, fierce, intense, sure, confident
weka: away, absent, missing, throw away, remove, get rid of
wile: to want, need, wish, have to, must, will, should
